answers.answer: I don't know anything about gestational diabetes but if I have learned anything it's to try and stay off of Google lol there has been countless amounts of time where I went to Google and it has done nothing but freaked me out and made me worry. I have heard of plenty of people that have had gestational diabetes though and I think it's more common then u think. Pregnancy itself is scary but try to remain calm and ask your doctor about things before getting freaked out lol

I have to see a fetal specialist tomorrow since I was diagnose with it and I'm definitely going to tell her all my concerns I usually stay quiet cause I'm shy to ask but tomorrow idc I'm going to ask so many questions lol
Lol it helps if you write the questions down. I also have so many questions and I always forget to ask at least one of them and then I go home mad aha

My paternal grandmother had GD (not regular diabetes type 1 or 2) and she had three kids who turned out great :)I am going for my glucose tolerance screening on Friday and am a little worried.... Did you have any symptoms?As long as you get it managed and under control through diet (and possibly insulin), the baby will be perfectly fine!

Gestational diabetes can easily be controlled with diet. I have it and don't even need to see my specialist anymore because I've made better choices with food. My girlfriend had it with both pregnancies and they turned out extremely healthy and neither was over 7 lbs. don't freak out this is something you can control :) and my advice is to stay off google lol
I've bee messing up I've reduce my eating a lot I eat but not like that I'm scare to get my baby too fat :(
And I have no symptoms at all just regular pregnancy symptoms

Yes stay off Google, bcuz I had went on there and was reading about still born babies and was scared so now I have to rub my stomach every hour even if he sleep I play with my stomach to make sure he still moving.

A baby can die because its mother had GD during the pregnancy. BUT it is very rare. I don't know 1 in how many but its rare. It can happen when the baby is so big (fat) that it has trouble breathing. But if you give birth to a big baby, the medical staff knows the risk and will keep an eye on the baby to make sure it is fine. If necessary, it may have to have breathing aid for a day or 2. But if you live in a developped country and give birth in a hospital, there is nothing to worry about. Like the others said, try to stay off google and ask questions to medicaly trained people who can give you a correct answer.

Don't reduce what you're eating you're baby needs nutrients, just make smarter food choices.  Less processed foods and more fruits, veggies, with lean protein. If I can do it you can too, I'm due in two weeks and I've made it this far and baby's is measuring right on target. Not overweight at all.

question: I do not know why i just go on google ughhh so I have gestational diabetes and I was reading that my baby can die after birth bc of breathing problems due to me having gestational diabetes omggg I feel like crying I'm so freaked out now has anyone else had gestational diabetes and their baby was perfectly fine ?
title: SCAREEEE!!
